definitions:
to addict (to cause someone to become addicted)


Seus amigos o viciaram em drogas.

His friends addicted him to drugs.




Este jogo me viciou.

This game got me addicted.

(intransitive) to be addictive


Cigarro vicia.

Cigarettes are addictive.

to spoil; to corrupt


O fedor viciou o quarto.

The stench spoiled the room.

to adulterate


Os dados foram viciados.

The dice have been adultered.
description: viciar (first-person singular present indicative vicio, past participle viciado)
etymology: From Latin vitiāre, present active infinitive of vitiō (“I make faulty”).
